title: 112_s2050
content: The Small Business Tax Extenders Act of 2012 extends the temporary exclusion of 100 percent of gain on certain small business stock until January 1, 2013. This amendment applies to stock acquired after December 31, 2011. SEC. 3 extends the 5-year carryback of general business credits for eligible small businesses to include taxable years after 2010. SEC. 4 extends alternative minimum tax rules for general business credits for eligible small businesses to include taxable years after 2010. SEC. 5 extends the reduction in recognition period for built-in gains tax. SEC. 5 extends the reduction in recognition period for built-in gains tax to include taxable years after 2011, with amendments applying to installment sales and an effective date after December 31, 2011. SEC. 6 extends increased expensing limitations and includes certain real property as Section 179 property. Section 179(b) is amended to include 2012, 2013, and 2014 in various provisions. The inflation adjustment for 2013 is also updated, along with changes for computer software and election years. Special rules for qualified real property now cover 2012 as well. Section 179(f)(1) is amended to include 2012 in addition to 2010 and 2011. These amendments will apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2011. SEC. 7. Extension of special rule for long-term contract accounting to January 1, 2013 (January 1, 2014). Effective for property placed in service after December 31, 2010. SEC. 8. Extension of increased deduction for start-up expenditures to 2011 and 2012. Effective for amounts paid or incurred in taxable years beginning after December 31, 2010. SEC. 9. Extension of deduction for health insurance in computing self-employment taxes. The amendment to section 162(l) extends the deadline to December 31, 2012. It applies to taxable years starting after December 31, 2010.
